extendedIngredients.name: peaches
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 cups chopped peeled fresh peaches or frozen unsweetened sliced peaches, thawed and drained

extendedIngredients.name: purple plums
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 cups sliced peeled fresh purple plums

recipes.title: Peach Plum Pie

winePairing.pairingText: Lambrusco Dolce, Late Harvest Riesling, and Vin Santo are great choices for Pie. These wines are all sweet, which is important since wine should usually be sweeter than the food you're pairing with it. You could try McFadden Late Harvest Riesling. Reviewers quite like it with a 5 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 18 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: McFadden Late Harvest Riesling
productMatches.description: Late Harvest and Botrytis-blessed, like Château d'Yquem, this is a sublime experience. Honeyed apricot meets baked apple pie in a glass. Quite simply, this is the best dessert wine you will taste, even at double the price, in your lifetime.

recipes.instructions: Directions                                                                                In a large bowl, combine the peaches, plums, lemon juice and extract. In another bowl, combine sugar, tapioca, lemon peel and salt. Add to fruit mixture and stir gently; let stand for 15 minutes. Line a 9-in. pie plate with bottom crust; add the filling. Dot with butter.                                                                                            Roll out remaining pastry to fit top o pie; cut slits in pastry. Place over filling. Trim, seal and flute edges. Cover the edges loosely with foil.                                                                                            Bake at 450° for 10 minutes. Reduce heat to 350°. Remove foil; bake 35 minutes longer or until crust is golden brown and filling is bubbly.                                        Yield: 6-8 servings.                                                                                                                         Originally published as Peach Plum Pie in  Taste of HomeJune/July 1998, p29                                                                                                                                                                                                        Nutritional Facts                                                                             1 serving (1 slice) equals 472 calories, 17 g fat (8 g saturated fat), 18 mg cholesterol, 303 mg sodium, 79 g carbohydrate, 1 g fiber, 3 g protein.                                                                                                                                                                     Print                                                                                    Add to Recipe Box                            Email a Friend

steps.step: In a large bowl, combine the peaches, plums, lemon juice and extract. In another bowl, combine sugar, tapioca, lemon peel and salt.
Add to fruit mixture and stir gently; let stand for 15 minutes. Line a 9-in. pie plate with bottom crust; add the filling. Dot with butter.
Roll out remaining pastry to fit top o pie; cut slits in pastry.
Place over filling. Trim, seal and flute edges. Cover the edges loosely with foil.
Bake at 450° for 10 minutes. Reduce heat to 350°.
Remove foil; bake 35 minutes longer or until crust is golden brown and filling is bubbly.
